title: The Girl Cant Help It - Frank Tashlin (1956)
description:
The Girl Can't Help It (1956)


Director: Frank Tashlin

Language: English

Cast: Tom Ewell
      Jayne Mansfield
      Edmond O'Brien
      Henry Jones
      Barry Gordon	 	 
      Julie London
      Little Richard	
      Ray Anthony



I'll make my praise brief. The Girl Can't Help It is more than a good film, more than a funny film, more than an excellent parody; it is a kind of masterpiece of the genre.

We are dealing with a variation - or, if you will, variations - on the Pygmalion theme. In this case, the sculptor falls in love with a model he refuses to carve. 

The story is put togheter out og 347 gags - Tashlin counted himself - with seven or eight musical numbers that are remarkably well directed and elevate rock and roll even as they satirize it.

Tashlin exaggerates Jayne's Mansfield statuesque figure with false breasts and all the rest of it, but instead of ridiculing her, he makes her a likeble and moving personality, like <arylin Monroe in Bus Stop.

The Girl Can't Help It is funny all the way through, and beautiful all the way trough as well. The picnic on the beach, when Jayne Mansfield sits by the sea in a bathing suit and talks, is a wonderful exemple.

I had a chance to see The Girl Can't Help It three times before I finished these notes. Like all great films, it's more beautiful and more successful each time you see it. You laugh less, but you love it more each time, and you feel increased emotion.  
->>>>   FranÃƒÂ§ois Truffaut, in The Films in My Life
